channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Jobs Slowdown Frustrates Investors Who Wanted Certainty on the Fed
item.description: Revisions and other distortions mean monetary policy outlook remains hazier than Wall Street would have liked.

item.title: ‘It’s the story of my life’: Have I missed the boat on 9% CDs? I was too late to invest in the housing market.
item.description: “Where should I invest my money, assuming that I won’t be able to buy a home for several years?”

item.title: The King of Risky Hometown Bonds Is Back
item.description: Former Nuveen executive John Miller begins a second act at First Eagle.

item.title: What to make of Nvidia’s pullback
item.description: Also: A moment truth for Boeing, and what to do before the Federal Reserve cuts interest rates.

item.title: China's Forex Reserves Rose in August as U.S. Dollar Weakened
‘There’s a lot of uncertainty in life’: These Gen Z workers are crushing retirement already. What the rest of us can learn.
item.description: Generation Z is “focused” and “intentional” when it comes to planning for the future.

item.title: The Wall Street Firm That Wants Its Traders Playing Poker
item.description: Trading giant Susquehanna uses Texas Hold ’em to teach its teams to make the most of risk. We asked some traders to play and walk us through their han...

item.title: Taking $1,000 from your 401(k) for emergencies is easier than ever — but consider these options first
item.description: Tapping your 401(k) can be preferable to taking on high-interest debt, but here’s what you need to know about how it works and what alternatives are o...

item.title: Are You Ready to Bet on U.S. Elections? A Judge's Ruling Opens the Door
item.description: Prediction-market startup Kalshi prevails in its bid to list political contracts, beating the CFTC.

item.title: Dow logs worst week since 2023 after softer-than-expected U.S. jobs report
item.description: U.S. stocks sold off sharply Friday after the latest jobs report renewed worries over a softening labor market, in a tumultuous start to September.
